PyAnnotation Module - PyAnnotation.py¶

class PyAnnotation.PyAnnotation[source]¶

A PyAnnotation is the artifcat being annotated. An annotation is a labelled feature structure. The annotation class/interface also provides convenience methods for setting and getting values from a feature structure.

__init__()[source]¶

Construct a new C{PyAnnotation}.

Parameters:
  • label – C{str}
  • features – C{list} of C{PyFeature} objects
  • set – this C{PyAnnotation}’s C{PyAnnotationSet}
  • element – a C{PyGraphElement} object
add(name, value)[source]¶

Creates and adda a C{PyFeature} to this C{PyAnnotation}.

Parameters:
  • name – name of the C{PyFeature} to be added
  • value – value of the C{PyFeature} to be added
add_feature(f)¶

Adds the passed C{PyFeature} to this C{PyAnnotation}.

Parameters:f – C{PyFeature} object
features()[source]¶

Returns the features.

Returns:C{list} of the C{PyFeature}s of this C{PyAnnotation}
from_annotation(a)¶

Construct a new C{PyAnnotation}.

Parameters:a – a C{PyAnnotation} object
get_feature(name)¶

Searches for a C{PyFeature} in this C{PyAnnotation}’s C{list} by name.

Parameters:name – C{str}
Returns:C{PyFeature}
get_feature_value(name)¶

Searches for a C{PyFeature} in this C{PyAnnotation}’s C{list} by name, returns that C{PyFeature}’s value.

Param :C{str}
Returns:C{str} or None
